definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The invention discloses a construction method for a door opening of an old structural underground wall.
sentences.chinese: 本發明公開了一種老結構地下牆開門洞施工方法。

sentences.english: But she could not even get her head through the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 可是那個門洞小得連她的腦袋都鑽不進去。

sentences.english: Dozens of hoses snaked through open doors or holes in the walls.
sentences.chinese: 從門洞和牆洞裏伸出許多水管，盤繞散落。

sentences.english: Drill holes on the top of the doorway according to the hole position on the guiding track. Fill in plastic plug when necessary.
sentences.chinese: 根據導軌孔位在門洞上端鑽孔，必要時打入膠塞。

sentences.english: Inscribed above the door, "security", local people said that this was South openings .
sentences.chinese: 門洞上方鐫刻“保障”二字，當地人說，這是南門洞。

sentences.english: Inscribed above the door, "security", local people said that this was South openings .
sentences.chinese: 門洞上方鐫刻“保障”二字，當地人說，這是南門洞。

sentences.english: Cascading effect through the doorway is the pool.
sentences.chinese: 穿過門洞是疊水效果的水池。

sentences.english: A skull appeared suspended in the gloom of the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 在黑魆魆的門洞裏彷彿出現了一個懸在半空的骷髏。

sentences.english: The thief lured him to the doorway and his accomplice hit him on the head.
sentences.chinese: 小偷把他引到了門洞裏，他的同夥在他頭上重重一擊。

sentences.english: Half a dozen soldiers, leaning on their spears, stood on each side.
sentences.chinese: 六個十兵，倚着長矛，站在城門洞的兩邊。

sentences.english: Doorways and window grilles are designed in various ways and are characteristic of the Chinese garden.
sentences.chinese: 門洞和窗格設計的多種多樣是中國園林的特徵。

sentences.english: Doorways and alcoves on street level are a better option.
sentences.chinese: 大街上的門道和門洞是個更好的選擇。

sentences.english: A house-shaped doorway provides the building's entrance, leading directly into the atrium.
sentences.chinese: 建築的入口是一個房屋形狀的門洞，直接地引向庭院。

sentences.english: The narthex is usually separated from the nave by columns or a pierced wall.
sentences.chinese: 一般用柱子或開了門洞的牆將前廊與中堂分隔開。

sentences.english: Visual downstairs to the provision of the South arch openings, recessed door was half-moon .
sentences.chinese: 鐘鼓樓下南向闢拱券門洞，門楣凹進呈半月形。

definition: lintel (of a door)/fig. family's social status
door/the opening panel of a door
